verbose_text: Not only are the pro inflammatory AA derived prostaglandins, leukotrienes, thromboxanes and hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acids (HETE) partially replaced by their less potent n-3 counterparts [XREF_BIBR]; moreover hydroxylation of EPA and DHA can lead to hydroxyeicosapentaenoic acids (HEPE) and hydroxydocosahexaenoic acids (HDHA) respectively, of which a few, namely 18-HEPE, 17-HDHA and 14-HDHA, are precursors of highly anti-inflammatory and pro resolving resolvins, protectins and maresins [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
